result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Allan Erickson

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 7, 2022 at 11:50 am.

9:16 AM Defendant Daniel Allan Erickson in court.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Daniel Allan Erickson.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad appeared by Zoom audio only for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Brewer only appointed on 22CF16, not 22CF55 yet.  Court questions Atty Brewer.  Atty Brewer asks def to contact PD office.  PTC to be scheduled in 22CF16 at 11:50 a.m.  22CF55 to track with this case.  Can be pretried same date if Atty Brewer is appointed.  Initial Appearance adjourned in 22CF55 to allow def to get atty and temporary waiver of time limits for prelim.  Nothing further.  Adj.  9:19 a.m.  klr
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Notice of hrg enclosed for 5/16/22
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2022 at 08:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 9:20 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears in person.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Def applied for public def.  Indicates he's not qualified.  Def is willing to waive counsel for today.  Def is aware of atty rights.  Def currently on bond of $7,000 with bifurcated bond provision of $500 cash.  Def states he thought bond was $5,000 total.  Bond was signed.  Court reaffirms bond.  If needs reduced, can file a motion.  Def waives time limits for prelim, but preserves rights.  Def anticipates will have attorney for PTC.  June 30 at 8:45 a.m.  Adj.  9:23 a.m.  klr
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
$7,000 bifurcated ($6500 signature)

**This is a bifurcated bond of $500 cash and $6500 signature bond.  Bond to be posted prior to release. **  Def shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances.  Def shall not be present in any bar (unless bar is part of a restaurant and def is there to eat or for employment.  Def shall submit to random PBTs upon request of law enforcement.

10:13 AM Defendant Daniel Allan Erickson in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def applied for public def.  Waiting for decision.  Court is scheduling for AIA on June 6 at 9:00 a.m.  Def asks that bond be clarified.  DA questions if def is allowed into bar for employment.   Asks court to address.  Def's request is that he be allowed in bars for employment.  DA has no objection.  Court grants request that he can be at bar to work but also adds provision of testing on demand of law enforcement.  Adj.  10:20 a.m.  klr

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel Allan Erickson
Current: 12646N S. Carey Dr., Hurley, WI 54534 United States  (Effective: 05-09-2022)
Prior: 210 Copper St, Hurley, WI 54534
to Court from def re bond modification, DFD, and counsel.
Status conference on May 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.

09:49 AM Defendant Daniel Allan Erickson not in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Order was signed to allow def a furlough.  Case to be rescheduled to 5/16 at 9:00 a.m. for AIA.  Adj.  9:50 a.m.  klr

10:32 a.m.  Mike Korpela presiding, DAR/klr, Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Case set for motion hearing.  Present also are members of ICSD, Richard Jenkins.  Def indicates is planning on going to Rhinelander Rehab Center.  Wil have attorney.  Def filed motion in writing.  Def was on probation hold.  Rehab is alternative to revocation, and bed is available tomorrow.  DA would like bond to stay as a cash bond with a provision that def can be released to go to treatment, then report back to Iron County after.  Def responds.  Probation Officer Mike Zorich questioned by Court.  P.O. hold lifted for def to go to treatment.  Grandparents taking him.  Does not believe def is a flight risk.  Discussion held.  Bond is to be stayed to allow def to go to treatment but must return to jail upon completion of treatment or pay cash bond.  Bond to be amended.  Bond will be in place.  Treatment is 30 days long.  Adj.  klr
Order for Furlough
for Bond Modification
Motion hearing on April 5, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:09 AM Defendant Daniel Allan Erickson in court, in custody.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case.  No counsel present yet for def.  Court reschedules AIA for 4/11 at 9:00 a.m.  Def is currently on PO hold and indicates doesn't have $500 to post if PO hold is lifted.  Court is not changing bond at this time.  Adj.  10:11 a.m.  klr  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on March 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:53 AM Defendant Daniel Allan Erickson in court, in custody.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def indicates Doug Muskett is going to be atty.  Case to be scheduled for another appearance.  Case reset for tomorrow at 10:00 a.m.  Adj.  10:59 a.m.  klr  Initial appearance scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ERICKSON, DANIEL:  3/11/22 PC/Bond hearing minutes:  1:31 p.m.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Court calls case.  Explains PC hearing.  Right to atty explained.  1:33 Office Hewitt sworn in, direct by DA.  Court questions Officer H.  Court finds PC.  Bond requested of $2500 cash with conditions.  Def has no problem with stipulations in bone but works and doesn't have cash.  Indicates lives at Copper Street and has lived there for 6 months.  Def states he always shows up for court.  DA agrees.  Court sets bifurcated bond of $500 cash/$4500 signature.  No alcohol, no presence in bars or restaurant except to eat.  No controlled substances.  Initial App on 3/21 at 9:00 a.m.  Told to contact public def office.  Adj.  1:41 p.m.  klr
